snippet: The road now followed by today’s golfers, from amateur to pro to V.I.P., is the one paved by Walter Hagen, who won his first United States Open 100 years ago.
abstract: Road now traveled by today's golfers, from amateur to pro to VIP, is one paved by Walter Hagen, who won his first United States Open in 1914; Hagen was the first golfer to travel far and wide to spread the gospel of golf, while getting rich from the collection plates, becoming the first player to earn $1 million.
lead_paragraph: The road now followed by today’s golfers, from amateur to pro to V.I.P., is the one paved by Walter Hagen, who won his first United States Open 100 years ago.

headline.seo: Walter Hagen Went From Amateur to Pro to V.I.P. and Transformed the Sport
headline.main: A Golfer Who Lived Large and Played Larger
headline.print_headline: He Lived Large and Played Larger
